clinical_study.brief_title: Neoveil® Versus TachoSil® for the Treatment of Pulmonary Air Leaks Following Lung Operation
clinical_study.official_title: Neoveil® Versus TachoSil® for the Treatment of Pulmonary Air Leaks Following Lung Operation

brief_summary.textblock: Postoperative prolonged air leak (PAL), referring to the passage of air from the lung parenchyma into the pleural space, is one of the most frequent postoperative complications after lung resection. To control air leak, there are two different products certified since years: TachoSil® and Neoveil®. This study is to investigate the difference of TachoSil® and Neoveil® in patients with PAL.

study_design_info.masking_description: Blinded participants and unblinded investigators and evaluators

primary_outcome.measure: time required till air leak closure has occurred (hours)
primary_outcome.time_frame: end of the operation (0 hours) until removal of the chest tubes or re-operation in case of prolonged air leak (first postoperative day)
primary_outcome.description: time interval between end of the operation (closure of the skin) and air leak closure (less than 30ml on the digitalized drainage system).

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of air leak (binary outcome 0/1), i.e. air loss > 30ml
secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of the operation (0 hours) until removal of the chest tubes or re-operation in case of prolonged air leak (first postoperative day)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of air leak (binary outcome 0/1), i.e. air loss > 30ml

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensity of air leak (continuous outcome, ml)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of the operation (0 hours) until removal of the chest tubes or re-operation in case of prolonged air leak (first postoperative day)
secondary_outcome.description: Intensity of air leak (continuous outcome, ml)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of prolonged air leak (>10 days) (binary outcome 0/1)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of prolonged air leak (>10 days) (binary outcome 0/1)

arm_group.description: TachoSil® is a collagen sponge coated with the human coagulation factors fibrinogen and thrombin.
Neoveil® sheet made of polyglycolic acid (PGA). It is a biodegradable, thermoplastic and non-antigenic polymer.

intervention.description: topical absorbable fibrin sealant patch applied directly on the lung area with air fistula.
bioabsorbable soft-tissue reinforcement material applied on the normal shape of the lung at the end of the operation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a pulmonary air leak following open lung surgery, regardless of whether an anatomical or atypical resection was performed
- Patients who are able to decide for themselves whether to participate in the study or not ( for example due to language problems, mental disorders, dementia of the participant)
- Patients who are not family member or employee of the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to follow the procedures of the study, for example, due to language problems, mental disorders, dementia of the participant
- Enrolment of the investigator, his/her family members, employees and other dependent persons
